instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage , fan spins for 10 secs extremely fast and then off.
threads.message:
hi , 
           we have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> motherboard and was not massively damaged by liquid but had liquid spill on few spots . the ppbus was 12.26 and when adapter was plugged in there was no green light but fan spins for 10 secs very fast and then goes off.  
         After cleaning the board and replacing SMC the board is exactly the same ppbus is 12.26 volts . no green light , fan spins for 10 secs on high and then off.

kindly advise

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage , fan spins for 10 secs extremely fast and then off.
threads.message: Is green light present now? Voltage on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL>? CPU Vcore coming on?
